00129 inline void
00130 BitBuffer::bitsHaveBeenUsed() const
00131 {
00132    DEBUG1(const_cast<BitBuffer*>(this)->m_bytesOK = false);
00133 }
00134 
00135 inline int
00136 BitBuffer::readNextBit()
00137 {
00138    bool retVal = (*m_pos & m_bitMask) != 0;
00139 
00140    m_bitMask >>= 1;
00141 
00142    if ( m_bitMask == 0x00 ) {
00143       m_bitMask = 0x80;
00144       m_pos++;
00145    }
00146 
00147    return retVal;
00148 }
00149 
00150 inline uint32
00151 BitBuffer::readNextBits(int nbrBits)
00152 {
00153    MC2_ASSERT(nbrBits > 0);
00154    bitsHaveBeenUsed();
00155    // This could probably be optimized.
00156    uint32 value = 0;
00157    while ( nbrBits-- ) {
00158       value <<= 1;
00159       value |= readNextBit();
00160    }
00161    return value;
00162 }
00163 
00164 inline int32
00165 BitBuffer::readNextSignedBits(int nbrBits)
00166 {
00167    bitsHaveBeenUsed();
00168    // This could probably be optimized.
00169    // Add the sign-extension if needed.
00170    uint32 value = readNextBit();
00171    if ( value ) {
00172       value = 0xffffffff;
00173    }
00174    // Skip one bit and read the others as usual.
00175    while ( --nbrBits ) {
00176       value <<= 1;
00177       value |= readNextBit();
00178    }
00179    return int32(value);
00180 }
00181 
00182 inline void
00183 BitBuffer::writeNextBit(int value)
00184 {
00185    if ( value ) {
00186       *m_pos |= m_bitMask;      
00187    } else {
00188       *m_pos &= (0xff ^ m_bitMask);
00189    }
00190    m_bitMask >>= 1;
00191 
00192    if ( m_bitMask == 0x00 ) {
00193       m_bitMask = 0x80;
00194       m_pos++;
00195    }
00196 
00197    
00198 }
00199 
00200 inline void
00201 BitBuffer::writeNextBits(uint32 value, int nbrBits)
00202 {
00203    bitsHaveBeenUsed();
00204    value <<= (32-nbrBits);
00205    while ( nbrBits-- ) {
00206       writeNextBit( (value & 0x80000000) != 0 );
00207       value <<= 1;
00208    }
00209 }
00210 
00211 inline uint32 
00212 BitBuffer::getCurrentBitOffset() const
00213 {
00214    uint32 nbrBits = (m_pos - m_buf) << 3; // *8
00215 
00216    switch ( m_bitMask ) {
00217       case ( 0x80 ) :
00218          return nbrBits;
00219       case ( 0x40 ) :
00220          return nbrBits + 1;
00221       case ( 0x20 ) :
00222          return nbrBits + 2;
00223       case ( 0x10 ) :
00224          return nbrBits + 3;
00225       case ( 0x08 ) :
00226          return nbrBits + 4;
00227       case ( 0x04 ) :
00228          return nbrBits + 5;
00229       case ( 0x02 ) :
00230          return nbrBits + 6;
00231       case ( 0x01 ) :
00232          return nbrBits + 7;
00233       default:
00234          // This should not happen.
00235          MC2_ASSERT( false );
00236          return nbrBits;
00237    }
00238 }
